Right upper quadrant to include (R) renal artery for arterial bruits

Left lower quadrant to include (L) iliac artery for arterial bruits

Percuss/Palpate.name: Correct technique: observation of patient's face during examination
Deep palpation in 4 quadrants (must follow light palpation)

Special-Screening-Techniques.name: Liver Scratch Test - Bell or diaphragm on right costal margin, scratch for sound changes over liver borders on MCL.
Murphy's Sign - Palpation under right costal margin while patient inhales quickly and deeply. Examiner notes pain or notes patient stops inspiration.
Rebound Tenderness - Firm slow palpation followed by immediate release. Note pain if increases with release.
Rovsing's Sign - Rebound tenderness maneuver on LLQ screening for RLQ pain response.
Shifting Dullness - Repeating percussion with patient rolled to either side, noting changes in percussion note.
Fluid Wave - Patient forms barrier down abdominal midline. Examiner taps one side while palpating for impulse on other side of abdomen. Fluid, not fat, transmits impulse.
Psoas Sign - Hip flexion against resistance reproduces pain response.
Obturator Sign - Painful internal rotation of the hip while hip and knee are flexed.
Obturator Sign - Painful internal rotation of the hip while hip and knee are flexed.
